newsitem.title: UK: SOCCER-ARSENAL'S TITLE HOPES DENTED BY 1-1 DRAW.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-ARSENAL'S TITLE HOPES DENTED BY 1-1 DRAW.

text.p: Arsenal's slim title hopes all but disappeared on Saturday when they conceded a late equaliser to draw 1-1 at home with 1995 champions Blackburn.
Arsenal took an early lead through England midfielder David Platt but Garry Flitcroft scored in the 89th minute to deny the Gunners three points.
Arsene Wenger's side go second, level on points with Liverpool, but both teams are five points adrift of leaders and champions Manchester United who have a game in hand on their two rivals.

United, who face Borussia Dortmund in a European Cup semifinal on Wednesday, took a giant leap toward their fourth league title in five years when they beat Liverpool 3-1 at Anfield earlier in the day.
Newcastle stay fourth after they overturned a 1-0 deficit to beat Derby 3-1.
At the bottom, beaten League Cup beaten finalists Middlesbrough lost 1-0 at home to neighbours Sunderland while Coventry, Southampton, Nottingham Forest, West Ham and Everton all drew.
